parameters: \pop[2]I throw my head back and take a shot. The alcohol quickly burns my throat.
\pop[2]After a couple coughs, I let out a noise that signals my satisfaction.
\pop[2]I can't help but feel happy, as a warm feeling rises within me.
\pop[5]I guess Delta is a lightweight, too.
Looks like you have some competition, Taylor.
\pop[3]Hey, it's not a competition if the victor is clear.
A hundred bucks says I pass out before they do.
We need a theme song for Taylor's demise.
\pop[6]As if your ego needs to get any bigger.
If I could afford it, my money would go right on Delta.
I thought your books were best sellers.
\pop[6]Anyway, what do you want to hear?
You all okay if I put on some Klace?
\pop[5]You know, I heard he could, too.
He'd fit in well with us, then.
\pop[6]Whoa, whoa, whoa. Speak for yourself, man.
We don't all hit on everyone we see.
\pop[5]Yeah, I made sure to warn my friend about that.
Meeting a boozed up Taylor is certainly an experience.
\pop[3]But go ahead. Put on some Klace.
Not very party-like, just sitting here in silence.
\pop[2]Dante smiles, and pulls out his phone.
\pop[2]The speakers in the corners of the room let out a noise, signaling his connection.
\pop[2]After a few moments of scrolling through his device, he decides on a song.
\pop[2]He presses play with a wide grin on his face, and music fills the room.
\pop[2]Isaac grabs the bottle of vodka resting on the table, and stands up tall.
\pop[2]He slides his shot glass across the table, in my direction.
\pop[2]Dante does the same, but in Taylor's direction.
\pop[2]Oh no. They really do want to test our tolerance.
\pop[2]He throws the bottle in the air, and catches it with a flourish.
\pop[2]He walks over to me, and fills up both shot glasses with vodka.
\pop[2]A moment later, he does the same to Taylor, topping us up.
\pop[2]I tell him I'll do it, as long as him and Dante do it, too.
Four for you, four for us.
\pop[6]You really want us to pass out, huh?
Don't think your friend would like being stood up.
Remember, we're not leaving for three more hours.
\pop[2]As if that was a direct challenge, Taylor and I both take our shots.
\pop[2]Then, in one swift motion, we slide the glasses over to Isaac and Dante.
\pop[2]Filling them up almost immediately, Isaac then strikes a thinking pose.
\pop[2]Taylor's inebriation is becoming clear, as he wobbles slightly.
\pop[2]If the earlier wager were official, I guess he'd be "winning".
\pop[5]I live by many rules, but one has never let me down.
Always let a writer make the toast. It's what they do best.
\pop[6]It's my \c[14]job\c[0], it's not a party trick.
But sure, let me think of something.
\pop[2]Him and Isaac both pick up one shot glass in unison.
\pop[2]There's a pause for a few moments while Dante decides what to say.
\pop[2]But after a little while of thinking, he seems to give up, and laugh.
\pop[6]You know what? This one's just from the heart.
Here's to getting wasted with the people that matter.
And with any luck, that list will keep on growing.
\pop[2]Taylor and I hold our hands up, like we were taking shots as well.
\pop[2]We all say cheers, and they down the vodka faster than Isaac poured it.
\pop[2]Talk about getting a head start on the night. Buzzed before suppertime.
\pop[3]Speaking of which, who are we meeting?
You gonna tell us who this friend of yours is?
I've never met him; so it's not just you.
\pop[3]And you think \c[14]I\c[0] move fast with guys...
\pop[5]It's not like he's a stranger, man.
He's just never been in town until today.
\pop[5]But we've been friends online for a while now.
Trust me, he's good. No need to worry.
\pop[3]Anyone who gives me free booze is good in my books.
I just thought you met him before, with how much you've been saying.
\pop[5]Nope. Just the anxiety making me ramble.
\pop[5]Hence, all the liquid courage we just ingested.
Might want to switch to rum, though. Vodka's running dry.
\pop[2]He shakes the bottle with an embarrassed laugh.
\pop[2]We've already gone through a whole bottle? Wow.
\pop[2]Isaac must have a weird definition of pacing.
\pop[3]I'll go grab the cola; I think it's time to start mixing.
Those straight shots are really starting to creep up on me.
\pop[2]With dramatic flair, he acts like he's passing out.
\pop[2]Then, a moment later, his head rests on my shoulder.
\pop[2]I laugh, and exchange awkward glances with everyone else.
\pop[3]Or maybe \c[14]you\c[0] could get it for me, Delta?
I fear I've gotten a bit light-headed over here.
\pop[2]I have no problem doing a favor for a friend, so I agree.
\pop[2]But a temptation rises within me to mess with him before I get up.
\pop[8]Looking down at him, I think of what message I'd like to send.
\pop[2]With a laugh, I shove him off my shoulder.
\pop[2]He lets out an exaggerated gasp, like I hurt his feelings.
\pop[2]I wrap an arm around him, and give him a tight squeeze.
\pop[2]The others look a bit surprised, but Taylor sounds incredibly happy.
\pop[3]I'd tell you not to let go, but I \c[14]really\c[0] wanted that cola.
\pop[2]A few chuckles fill the room, as I stand up and walk to the fridge.
\pop[2]The cola is easy to find, even amongst the booze-filled appliance.
\pop[2]When I make it back to the table, I notice that Dante is holding the rum.
\pop[2]He sighs, as he shakes the bottle, swirling the liquid inside.
\pop[5]We can always buy more. It's cheap stuff.
I meant all of this; in general.
\pop[6]Sitting down with your best friends, getting drunk during the day.
Downing shot after shot, like our bodies aren't starting to hate us.
\pop[6]Yeah. But at least we made the most of it.
Couldn't have asked for a better group of friends.
\pop[5]Dude, I feel exactly the same way.
\pop[5]I can't even imagine what life would be like without all of you.
Just the thought of it is enough to keep me up at night. And it does.
\pop[6]Oh...? Finally confessing your feelings for all of us?
It's just; we're so close now, but...
Are we still in touch in any of your visions?
\pop[2]I shrug, since it's pretty obvious that I've never had a vision.
\pop[2]But the rest of them exchange worried glances with one another.
\pop[2]They didn't have to say anything. I know exactly what they're thinking.
\pop[5]Exactly. I can't get it off my mind.
\pop[5]I think of you all as my family.
But in my vision, you're not even an afterthought.
\pop[2]By now, Dante has fixed all of us some rum and cola.
\pop[2]The mood in the room took a turn for the worse, and I stare at my glass.
\pop[2]I'm not sure how I fit into this conversation. I'm definitely still the odd one out.
\pop[3]Hey! We're together now, and that's what matters.
\pop[3]If you're constantly worried about the future, you'll never enjoy the present.
We could drift apart, yeah. But no point just moping around until it happens.
\pop[2]Isaac looks up from his glass with a smile.
\pop[3]Remember what you said about foresight? In the group chat?
\pop[3]If we know we might stop being friends, then we need to make the most of it.
And I don't know about you, but I think tonight is the \c[14]perfect\c[0] night for that.
But why do we have to drift apart?
\pop[5]Who says we can't be friends forever?
I won't let anything take you away from me.
\pop[3]I don't know if we're equipped to fight \c[23]fate\c[0], man.
And if well-wishing were a weapon, the world would be much better off.
\pop[3]Let's just create some memories that we can revisit whenever we want.
\pop[2]Isaac's mood almost instantly reverses, and he holds up his glass.
\pop[2]We touch our glasses together, then take a laaaaaarge swig.
Using my own words against me.
\pop[5]Guess it's true what they say, though.
Your own advice is always better when it comes from somebody else.
\pop[3]We're all creatures of self-doubt, man. Can't escape that.
But don't worry, Isaac. I'm not going anywhere.
\pop[3]I'm not sure if we can beat \c[23]fate\c[0]...
But I promise to put up one hell of a fight!
\pop[2]That seemed like the perfect end to our discussion.
\pop[2]Moving on to more casual topics, we slowly sip our drinks.
\pop[2]But this is the first time I've seen the more negative effects of \c[17]Komorebi\c[0].
\pop[2]A group of people realizing they might not be friends forever...
\pop[2]There's something so liberating, yet terrifying about that.
\pop[2]It almost seemed like a right of passage into maturity.
\pop[2]But here I sat, with no vision to my name, and no input at all.
\pop[2]As my new life kept going, I'd have no idea what the future could bring.
\pop[2]And that thought alone was almost as liberating and terrifying as the alternative.
